page.title: 14HEMPSTEAD HALL FARM.
page.content: HEMPSTEAD HALL HAS BEEN IN WILLIAM MACK'S FAMILY SINCE{1933,}BUT THE HOUSE WAS BUILT IN{1880.}HIS BIGGEST FIELD COVERS 55 ACRES. ALTOGETHER ALL OF HIS FIELDS{COVER 300 ACRES.}HE GROWS SUGAR-BEET, POTATOES AND CORN. HE USES KITES AND BIRD-SCARERS. HE USES APHID SPRAY TO KILL THE PESTS. LIKE MOST OF THE FARMS IN THE AREA HE HAS NO LIVESTOCK, BUT HE HAS SOME PETS. THE BUSIEST TIME OF THE YEAR FOR HIM IS AUGUST, SEPTEMBER AND OCTOBER. HE HAS{1 WORKER,}BUT 20 YEARS AGO HIS DAD HAD{5,}EXCEPT FOR HARVEST TIME WHEN HE HAD{30.}HE HAS 3 PONDS WHICH HAVE FISH IN. THE FISH ARE ROACH, TENCH AND PERCH. HE HAS A COMBINE, A TRACTOR, A HEDGE CUTTER AND A PLOUGH. SOME OF HIS LAND IS FOREST. IN HIS SPARE TIME THE FARMER ENJOYS PLAYING CRICKET, HOCKEY, AND SNOOKER.
